019package org.jgrapes.osgi.core;
020
021import java.util.Arrays;
022import java.util.Collections;
023import java.util.HashMap;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.function.Function;
027import static java.util.function.Predicate.not;
028import java.util.stream.Collectors;
029import java.util.stream.Stream;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
031import org.jgrapes.core.ComponentFactory;
032import org.jgrapes.core.events.Stop;
033import org.jgrapes.util.ComponentProvider;
034import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
035import org.osgi.framework.BundleContext;
036import org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference;
037import org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker;
038import org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTrackerCustomizer;
039
040/**
041 * A component that collects all services from the OSGi service registry
042 * which implement the {@link ComponentFactory} interface. It uses each 
043 * to create one or more components that are then attached to the 
044 * component collector instance.
045 * 
046 * Effectively, the component collector leverages OSGi's service layer
047 * to modify the component tree at run-time.
048 * 
049 * This class uses {@link ComponentProvider#setFactories(ComponentFactory...)} 
050 * and {@link ComponentProvider#setPinned(List)} for its implementation.
051 * As it inherits from {@link ComponentProvider}, it automatically
052 * supports the provisioning of additional components through
053 * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events. If this is not desired, invoke
054 * {@link ComponentProvider#setComponentsEntry(String)} with `null` as
055 * argument. 
056 * 
057 * @param <F> the component factory type
058 */
059@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis",
060    "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis" })
061public class ComponentCollector<F extends ComponentFactory>
062        extends ComponentProvider implements ServiceTrackerCustomizer<F, F> {
063
064    private static final List<Map<Object, Object>> SINGLE_DEFAULT
065        = Arrays.asList(Collections.emptyMap());
066
067    private BundleContext context;
068    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SingularField")
069    private ServiceTracker<F, F> serviceTracker;
070    private Function<String, List<Map<Object, Object>>> configurator;
071
072    /**
073     * Creates a collector component that uses a {@link ServiceTracker} 
074     * to monitor the addition and removal of component factories.
075     * 
076     * @see #addingService(ServiceReference)
077     * @see #removedService(ServiceReference, ComponentFactory)
078     *
079     * @param componentChannel this component's channel
080     * @param context the OSGi {@link BundleContext}
081     * @param factoryCls the factory class
082     * @param configurator the function that provides the pinned configurations
083     */
084    public ComponentCollector(
085            Channel componentChannel, BundleContext context,
086            Class<F> factoryCls,
087            Function<String, List<Map<Object, Object>>> configurator) {
088        super(componentChannel);
089        this.context = context;
090        this.configurator = configurator;
091        serviceTracker = new ServiceTracker<>(context, factoryCls, this);
092        serviceTracker.open();
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Utility constructor that uses each factory to create a single instance,
097     * using an empty map as properties.
098     *
099     * @param componentChannel this component's channel
100     * @param context the bundle context
101     * @param factoryClass the factory class
102     */
103    public ComponentCollector(Channel componentChannel, BundleContext context,
104            Class<F> factoryClass) {
105        this(componentChannel, context, factoryClass, type -> SINGLE_DEFAULT);
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Whenever a new factory is added, it is used to create component 
110     * instances with this component's channel. First, the `configurator`
111     * passed to the constructor is invoked with the name of the class 
112     * of the component to be created as argument. The list of maps 
113     * returned is then added to the pinned components 
114     * (see {@link ComponentProvider#setPinned(List)}). 
115     * 
116     * The map return from the `configurator` is automatically augmented
117     * with an entry with key {@link BundleContext}.class and the bundle 
118     * context passed to the constructor.
119     *
120     * @see ServiceTrackerCustomizer#addingService(ServiceReference)
121     */
122    @Override
123    public F addingService(ServiceReference<F> reference) {
124        F factory = context.getService(reference);
125        if (factories().containsKey(factory.componentType().getName())) {
126            // Factory for the new component type is already known.
127            return factory;
128        }
129
130        // Add configuration to provider before adding new factory
131        List<Map<?, ?>> newConfigs = Stream.concat(
132            // filter existing configs to avoid duplicates
133            pinned().stream().filter(not(c -> factory.componentType().getName()
134                .equals(c.get(COMPONENT_TYPE)))),
135            // add new configs
136            configurator.apply(
137                factory.componentType().getName()).stream().map(c -> {
138                    // Received may be immutable
139                    var newMap = new HashMap<>(c);
140                    newMap.put(BundleContext.class, context);
141                    if (!c.containsKey(COMPONENT_TYPE)) {
142                        newMap.put(COMPONENT_TYPE,
143                            factory.componentType().getName());
144                    }
145                    return newMap;
146                }))
147            .collect(Collectors.toList());
148        setPinned(newConfigs);
149
150        // Now add factory
151        ComponentFactory[] updatedFactories
152            = Stream.concat(factories().values().stream(), Stream.of(factory))
153                .toArray(s -> new ComponentFactory[s]);
154        setFactories(updatedFactories);
155        return factory;
156    }
157
158    /*
159     * (non-Javadoc)
160     * 
161     * @see org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTrackerCustomizer#modifiedService
162     */
163    @Override
164    public void modifiedService(ServiceReference<F> reference, F service) {
165        // Do nothing.
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * Deletes all child components with the type produced by the factory that 
170     * is removed. A (possibly) final {@link Stop} event is send to the
171     * detached subtrees which may be used to deactivate bundles.
172     * 
173     * @see ServiceTrackerCustomizer#removedService(ServiceReference, Object)
174     */
175    @Override
176    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
177    public void removedService(ServiceReference<F> reference, F service) {
178        // Remove factory.
179        ComponentFactory[] updatedFactories = factories().values().stream()
180            .filter(f -> !f.componentType().getName()
181                .equals(service.componentType().getName()))
182            .toArray(s -> new ComponentFactory[s]);
183        setFactories(updatedFactories);
184
185        // Remove configuration
186        List<Map<?, ?>> updatedConfigs = pinned().stream()
187            .filter(not(c -> service.componentType().getName()
188                .equals(c.get(COMPONENT_TYPE))))
189            .collect(Collectors.toList());
190        setPinned(updatedConfigs);
191    }
192}
